data.title: Discography for UK 1981
data.text:
[home] [contact]

[buy CDs/DVDs online]DURAN DURAN

& POWER STATION / ARCADIA

- Discography for UK 1981-1989 -

(1 April 2016) US digital EP/12" Girls on Film 1979 Demo

See Me Repeat Me 3.54

Reincarnation 2.58

Girls on Film 3.04

Working the Steel 3.24 (Cleopatra, CLO 0183)

Recorded in September 1979.

https://cleopatrarecords.bandcamp.com/album/girls-on-film-1979-demo

30 Jan 1981 7"/12" Planet Earth

Planet Earth 4.01 / Late Bar 2.54 (7": EMI-5137)

Planet Earth (Night Version) 6.16 // Planet Earth 4.01 / Late Bar 2.54 (12" 21 Feb: 12EMI-5137)

Produced by Colin Thurston.

Careless Memories 3.41 // Fame 3.16 / Khanada 3.25 (12": 12EMI-5168)

Produced by Colin Thurston.

9 June 1981 LP (+ CD) DURAN DURAN

Girls on Film 3.30

Planet Earth 4.01

Anyone Out There 4.01

To the Shore 3.49

Careless Memories 3.52 [slightly longer album version]

Night Boat 5.25

Sound of Thunder 4.06

Friends of Mine 5.44

Tel Aviv 5.16 (LP: EMI EMC3372)

Produced by Colin Thurston. A version of To the Shore with a 11 second longer intro was released on a US 1993 CD-maxi "Come Undone 2". It is not known whether this version was released before on some vinyl single.

Rio 5.33

My Own Way 4.48

Rio 5.33

Produced by Colin Thurston. Later versions of the RIO album featured remixed versions of many of the tracks, see http://www.ionpool.net/duran/rio.html for more info.

11 Aug 1982 7"/12" Save a Prayer

Save a Prayer 5.25 [single edit] / Hold Back the Rain (Remix) 3.58 (7": EMI-5327)

Save a Prayer 5.25 [single edit] / Hold Back the Rain (12" Remix) 7.05 (12": 12EMI-5327)

Produced by Colin Thurston.

Sep 1982 US/European remix 12"/MC EP Carnival

Hungry Like the Wolf [David Kerschenbaum Remix] 5.14 / Girls On Film [David Kerschenbaum Remix] 5.26 //

Hold Back the Rain [David Kerschenbaum Remix] 6.50 / My Own Way [David Kerschenbaum Remix] 4.27 (US 12": Harvest DLP-15006)

Hungry Like the Wolf (1982 Night Version) 5.14 / Rio (1982 Night Version) [remix by David Kerschenbaum] 6.36 //

Planet Earth (1981 Night Version) 6.20 / Girls On Film (1981 Night Version) 5.45 [= 15 sec longer] (European 12": EMI 1A 062Z-64942)

The Rio Night Version remix by David Kerschenbaum was reportedly also released in USA on a promo twelve-inch but I'm not sure which one. A 6 min 56 sec "Night Mix" version of Planet Earth was released in 1999 on the Duran Duran double CD compilation "STRANGE BEHAVIOUR" featuring 12" Mixes. It was most likely remixed in 1982 for the CARNIVAL EP but never used at the time.

Nov 1982 Japanese remix 12"/MC EP Carnival

Rio [7" Version] 5.02 [mis-labeled "Pt. II"] / Hold Back the Rain [1982 David Kerschenbaum Remix] 7.03 / My Own Way (1981 Night Version) 6.34 //

Hungry Like the Wolf (1982 Night Version) 5.11 / New Religion [New Unique Remix] 5.13 (Japanese 12": EMS-50125)

The Japanese-only remix of New Religion (remixed by David Kerschenbaum ?) was included on the 1999 Duran Duran double CD compilation "STRANGE BEHAVIOUR".

14 March 1983 non-LP 7"/12" Is There Something I Should Know?

Is There Something I Should Know? 4.08 / Faith in This Colour 4.06 (7": EMI-5371)

Is There Something I Should Know? (Monster Mix) 6.40 / Faith in This Colour 4.06 (12": 12EMI-5371)

Co-produced by Ian Little and Duran Duran, mixed by Ian Little and Alex Sadkin. The B-side of the first few hundred pressings of the 7" was mastered too slow by mistake (although it still had the same duration) and was later called 'Alternate Slow Mix'.

17 Oct 1983 7"/12" Union of the Snake

Union of the Snake (The Monkey Mix) 6.21 // Union of the Snake 4.20 / Secret October 2.44 (12": 12EMI-5429)

Produced by Alex Sadkin in association with Ian Little and Duran Duran.

Nov 1984 live-LP/CD ARENA

Is There Something I Should Know? 4.35

Hungry Like the Wolf 4.02

Save a Prayer 6.11

The Wild Boys 4.16

The Seventh Stranger 5.13

The Chauffeur 5.23

Planet Earth 4.32

Careless Memories 4.07 (LP: Parlophone DD2; CD: EMI CDP 7 46048 2)

Girls on Film

Rio (remastered CD 14 April 2004: 7243 5 78085 2)

All tracks recorded live around the world 1984 (except 'The Wild Boys' which is the studio single version). "The 20th anniversary re-issue has two extra tracks (Rio and Girls on Film), taken from the same California concert as all the other material, but not originally included on the vinyl release due to time constraints."

THE POWER STATION were: Robert Palmer (vocals), Andy Taylor (Duran Duran guitarist), John Taylor (Duran Duran bassist), Tony Thompson (drums), Bernard Edwards (producer).

May 1985 soundtrack 7" Duran Duran: A View to a Kill

A View to a Kill 3.34 / A View to a Kill (that fatal kiss) 2.28 (7": EMI, DURAN 007)

From the soundtrack to the James Bond film A VIEW TO A KILL. Side A produced by Bernard Edwards, Jason Corsaro and Duran Duran. Side B produced by John Barry.
